title: The Hawaiian story of the wind keepers - Sydney Iaukea

multiple-choice.question: Who is the Hawaiian wind goddess in the story?
What was passed from La'amaomao to her grandson Paka'a?
What did Paka'a learn from his grandfather and his father?
Why did the two navigators turn against Paka'a?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they were jealous of his skills

options.label: B
options.text: Because they wanted to overthrow the king

options.label: D
options.text: Because they were deceived by Paka'a's family

multiple-choice.question: What did Kuapaka'a do to help his father Paka'a return to the king's side?

options.label: A
options.text: He sailed to Ka'ula to meet the king

options.label: B
options.text: He maintained a storm on Moloka'i to earn the king's trust

options.label: C
options.text: He revealed his identity to the king

options.label: D
options.text: He challenged the king's navigators to a canoe race

multiple-choice.question: What was the wager that Kuapaka'a proposed to the eight fishermen?

options.label: A
options.text: His catch of flying fish against theirs

multiple-choice.question: What did the king ask Kuapaka'a to do after the canoe race?

options.label: A
options.text: To have mercy on the fishermen

options.label: C
options.text: To restore Paka'a to his position

multiple-choice.question: What did Paka'a and Kuapaka'a do after the king agreed to their deaths?

options.label: B
options.text: They maintained the storm on Moloka'i

options.label: C
options.text: They restored Paka'a to his position

options.label: D
options.text: They ensured the names of the winds would never be lost

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the canoe race between Kuapaka'a and the eight fishermen?
What was the result of Kuapaka'a's actions in the end?

options.label: A
options.text: The king and Paka'a were separated again

options.label: B
options.text: Paka'a was restored to his position

options.label: C
options.text: The names of the winds were lost forever

options.label: D
options.text: The king and Paka'a were reunited and the names of the winds were preserved
